item.title: Report X-2024021924
item.description:
Report X-2024021924

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-07T15:11:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-27
  • City: ROMOLAND
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A THREE DAY SELECT AIR PACKAGE WAS OBSERVED WITH FROST BUILDUP ON THE OUTSIDE AND WAS COLD TO THE TOUCH. THE OUTER FIBERBOARD BOX IS A PREPRINTED ZEP CONCENTRATED ALL-PURPOSE CLEANER BOX WITH ORIENTATION ARROWS AND "PROTECT FROM FREEZING NOT FOR AIR TRANSPORT" PREPRINTED ON THE PACKAGE. RESPONDER INSPECTED CONTENTS TO FIND LESS THAN APPOXIMATELY FIVE POUNDS OF DRY ICE PELLETS COOLING PET FOOD. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX TO INDICATE DRY ICE WAS BEING SHIPPED AIR SERVICE. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM CALIFORNIA USING UPS ACCOUNT 98568E, KHARTUNERZ, 41421 DATE ST, SUITE 108, MURRIETA CA 92562.

item.title: Report X-2024021779
item.description:
Report X-2024021779

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-07T15:11:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-22
  • City: CITY OF INDUSTRY
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1.X-2024021779 SequenceEvent: The package was discovered by the power turn for the NCs to be scanned. Once discovered we promptly cleaned the material up and placed it in a proper setup to be brought back to the Hazardous cage to be processed. DescribePack: Inside the box there is a plastic pail. On the bottle of the plastic pail, it opened. The whole entire bottom of the Plastic pail is falling off and it is leaking all of its powder. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: It was placed in a hazardous bag alongside a proper red tote to contain all the release. What released was swept up and placed in the proper bag/tote as well. 2. X-2024021782 SequenceEvent: Package was found at the power turn where we process NCs. Package was discovered and quickly cleaned up and placed in a hazmat bag and also in a red tote to be processed in our hazmat cage. DescribePack: The package has failure in the plastic pail inside the Box. It is cracked heavily at the bottom and is leaking a lot of its inner contents inside of the box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: It was placed in a hazmat bag to catch all of the powder that is releasing from the plastic pail. The contents that leaked was also placed in the hazmat bag.

item.title: Report E-2024030011
item.description:
Report E-2024030011

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-05T15:11:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-29
  • City: FONTANA
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On February 29, 2024, at 0645 ET, XPO Logistics Terminal USB experienced a release of UN1866 “Orthophthalic Resin” from a 55-gallon metal drum. On February 29, 2024, at 0714 ET, XPO Logistics retained Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) to complete all regulatory reporting. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct all on site cleanup activities. On February 29, 2024, at 0920 EST, contractors arrived on site. They confirmed approximately 1-gallon of product released to a 2’ x 2’ area of the trailer floor due to a pallet nail puncture. The damaged drum was placed into a 95-gallon poly overpack. Absorbents were then deployed and worked into the impacted area. All impacted absorbents and the impacted pallet wood were containerized into a 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was then staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024021863
item.description:
Report X-2024021863

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-05T15:11:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-27
  • City: OCEANSIDE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Exterior packaging was torn, and that torn piece had liquid staining on it. Inside, 4 qty of 1 Gallon of 200-Proof Non-Denatured Ethyl Alcohol each in a plastic container. DescribePack: One of the 4 containers had a loose cap spilling around 10 fl oz which soaked the exterior box and consequently tore the box. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: The package was immediately placed in a plastic lined container and wiped any spill with an absorbent pad.

item.title: Report X-2024021616
item.description:
Report X-2024021616

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-05T15:11:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-19
  • City: ALISO VIEJO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: TWO PACKAGES TO THE SAME CONSIGNEE WERE INSPECTED DUE TO OUTER BOXES MARKED AS CONTAINING LAPTOPS. UPON INSPECTION OF PACKAGE TRACKING NUMBER 1ZGH08190142345021 WE FOUND FIVE LAPTOPS CONTAINING LITHIUM ION BATTERIES. INSPECTION OF PACKAGE TRACKING NUMBER 1ZGH08190142821462 REVEALS AT LEAST TWELVE LAPTOPS CONTAINING LITHIUM ION BATTERIES. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS, LABELS OR DANGEROUS GOODS PAPERWORK ON THE OUTER BOXES. THE OUTER BOXES HAVE HP ENTERPRISE COMPUTERS PREPRINTED ON THEM. ONE OUTER BOX HAS TWO AREAS CUT OUT OF THE BOX AND WE CAN SEE A SLIGHT PART OF A LITHIUM BATTERY MARK INSIDE THE BOX. ALL BOXES INSIDE CONTAINING LAPTOPS DO HAVE PREPRINTED LITHIUM BATTERY MARKS. THE PACKAGES WERE SHIPPED FROM CALIFORNIA USING UPS ACCOUNT GH0819, SO CAL AUTO CLB SERVICE 004, 3333 FAIRVIEW RD, COSTA MESA CA 92626.

The lid was double checked for signs of any leakage, but it only leaked through the punctured hole. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Absorbent sheets were used to stop and clean up the spillage, A red hazardous bin and a clear hazardous materials bag were also used.

  • City: FRESNO

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 11:52 AM ET, Tami with terminal UFN contacted the call center to report a spill that was discovered inside of a trailer in Fresno, CA. The spill consists of (2) 1 gallon metal cans of VP 50:1 Pre-Mixed, which were discovered crushed and leaking inside of the cardboard box they arrived in, likely due to other freight loaded on top of it. The spill was approximately 2 cups and impacted the box only
